fed verb
(CATCH)
[ T usually passive ] UK, slang (of the police or someone in authority) to catch someone: Run or we'll get fedded. I got fedded for using my phone in class.

[ C usually plural ] US informal (also fed) a police officer who works for the F.B.I., or an officer who represents the central government: The Feds completely screwed up the arrest.
[ C usually plural ] slang (also fed) a police officer: Let's go, there's too many feds around here. the Fed
abbreviation for
the Federal Reserve
More examplesFewer examplesThere was a rumor that the Feds were going to be brought in.The feds decided to drop the investigation.Feds have approved nearly $1.5 million in emergency aid following the floods.She threatened to report us to the feds.
